page.title: 05SITTINGBOURNE'S EDUCATION
page.content: Sittingbourne has a very unique Education system.At the age of 13 you either change to go to a Grammar or you stay at a Comprehensive.The order of schools is Infant 5-7,Junior 7-11, Secondary 11-17,or Grammar 13-17.After that there are colleges or universities in other towns.Before school there are pre-school play groups.This helps give mothers a break from over-exited children.The Grammar schools are called Borden and Highsted,Borden for boys and Highsted for girls.The top 25% go to these schools.There are 4 Comprehensives in Sittingbourne,Rowena for girls, St.Johns for boys,and Fulston Manor and Westlands which are mixed.There is also a private school called the Convent which is run by Nuns and is for girls only.This system is complicated.
